title: 'login to server imap-mail outlook.com with username XXX@live.com failed'.
creator: alnali
content: For the last week or so, I get the message 'login to server imap-mail outlook.com with username XXX@live.com failed'. BUT, emails are still getting through, and I am still able to send them. The message gives me the option to 'Retry', 'Enter new password' or 'Cancel'. Each time, I have clicked on to 'cancel' but after a while, the message will pop up again. It is rather frustrating, as I have to stop what I am doing just to click 'Cancel'. As it is checking on three 'live.com' accounts, the message pops up all at once for all three. It is frustrating, and I am not sure if ALL emails are in fact getting through. When I click on the 'Junk' folder, it will give me the same pop up message, and although the top of the folder states there are 1 or 2 Junk emails, I cannot view or delete these. I have tried to look at Microsoft Outlook directly, but all seems fine there. No issues.
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:122.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/122.0;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird won't copy messages with attachments to "sent" folder.
creator: cswarners
content:
This is a recent issue. If I send an email with no images and no attachments, it copies the email into my "sent" folder with no problem.

If I send an email with even a small attachment...it sends the email, but "times out" copying the message to the sent folder.

I've checked the account/server settings, they are exactly as recommended. I've changed the sent files to "other"...no difference. I deleted and reinstalled Thunderbird...no change.

Ideas?

content: Da un paio di giorni che thunderbird mi chiede di reinserire la password .Lo faccio e dice in continuazione che è errata. Ho sostituito in Strumenti/Impstazioni la password vecchia con la nuova e tutto è sembrato OK.Ricevo nell'account avviso via mail che è stata reimpostata correttemanete,provo e sembra tutto OK. title: CONTINUA RICHIESTA DI INSERIMENTO PASSWORD
creator: annamaria.gremmo
content:
Buongiorno, da molti giorni appena accedo alla posta mi compare il messaggio che il server imap ha problemi di connessione con il mio account di hotmail e mi chiede di digitare la mia password.

Nonostante io metta il flag sull'opzione di memorizzazione della password (che peraltro io non ho assolutamente cambiato di recente, quindi non dovrebbe chiederla) la finestra del messaggio continua a presentarsi. A volte con plurime finestre aperte contemporaneamente. Questo problema è insorto in maniera assolutamente improvvisa e rende l'esperienza sulla posta molto inceppata e faticosa. Anche perchè se il sistema non recepisce la password, non scarica mail nè le invia. Era capitato in passato, ma reinserendo la password il problema si era risolto. Ora almeno una volta su due, quando accedo a Thunderbird, si presenta la finestra di avviso, blocca tutto il lavoro e sono costretta a digitare la password anche numerose volte, come se il sistema non la accettasse. Qualcuno può aiutarmi?
metadata: ;category:privacy-and-security;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

Connecting to the email server of caiway works fine, but I am unable to connect to a gmail. I have tried two different gmail accounts, both give the same error "Unable to connect". Is there anything I can do to solve this problem and enjoy using Thunderbird again?

title: Trash automatically being deleted even when set not to
creator: mozilla2410
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for decades, and my settings have always been to never delete my Trash, i.e. currently that is Tools > Account settings > Synch & Storage > Don't delete any messages. In the past few weeks I've discovered that now my trash is being automatically deleted somehow and everything prior to exactly 2 months from the day I check is gone. I can't find any other setting in Thunderbird that could be causing this and my hosting provider claims there is nothing on their server doing this either (I don't necessarily believe them though).

Has anyone noticed this? Was there a recent change in Thunderbird that ignores this setting somehow? It's exactly 2 months of trash that gets retained.

Thanks, -m
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Re-downloading messages without a reason
creator: ncherkasov
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for a year. It is ok, but some problems are borderline un-tolerable. I have ~3500 emails in my IMAP account. I would like to keep more for a deeper search, but ok - I could handle that. And once in a while, about every month, I am doing something and the Thunderbird decides to re-download all my messages. And it locks me out of all emails for about 2 hours while this process is ongoing. I cannot open emails, I cannot answer - nothing.

I have no "cleaning" software, I do not mess up with the database file.

Is there a way to avoid this re-download? If not, is it possible to avoid the lock-out, to get emails usable while it does it - for example, download the most recent emails first and make them visible at least?
metadata: ;category:fix-problems;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:122.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/122.0;product:thunderbird

content: I have a domain, deskdata.com. For reasons unknown, I have to include the domain in my username for the POP3 mail servers. title: Deleted IMAP Accout keeps on reappearing
creator: TAJetton
content:
I recently created an email account on Outlook.com and setup in TB. Followed prompts and mistakenly setup as IMAP. I want POP3, I like to download my messages. I deleted the IMAP account and created successfully the POP3 account. But when I exited TB and later on went back in the IMAP account reappeared and displayed in place on the POP3 account. I have tried everything I can think of. I've cleared cache/history, deleted the entire IMAP folder under my profile and removed 14 different files in my profile (e.g.cert9, Login json, prefs, etc). The IMAP account will not go away. I've probably deleted it 25 times and it just reappears.

Does anyone have any tricks to permanently removed the account? Have have no idea where the hell its picking the info up from to continuously regenerate the account. I'm using an fully updated version of TB 32-bit.

Thanks, Terry
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:122.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/122.0;product:thunderbird;solver_id:5745940

content:
Hello,

Nothing I have tried fixes it. I am in danger of losing access to all my of my email accounts on windows.

What is going wrong?

title: Upgrading Thunderbird to 115.7.0 has broken scanner pdf mail composition
creator: jepikul
content:
We have a Canon Pixma TR7021 and Thunderbird just updated to 115.7.0. Canon's IJ scan software has a feature where it can send messages to email, so we have it set up to go to Thunderbird. In the past, it opens the composer with a new message with the .pdf file as an attachment.

After the upgrade, we get a brief flash on the screen. The developer console shows the error below, but Thunderbird does not crash. Troubleshoot mode has the same issues. Replacing the Canon driver infrastructure did not fix. We are able to manually scan from that printer to a file and attach the file into a new message, so it is an issue with live importation of a .pdf document

title: Can't send emails
creator: tharrso
content:
Running TB 115.7.0 on an iMac. I've made no changes to any of the setting recently. Overnight it stopped being able to send messages. Instead I get this error message:

"Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Requested action not taken: mailbox unavailable Sender address is not allowed.. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again."

title: Two gmail accounts managed in Thunderbird, reply to email sent from first ends up returning to the second
creator: ramjr66
content:
I have two gmail accounts I monitor in TB. Both use the same gmail SMTP server (smtp.gmail.com). Otherwise the two accounts are completely separate. The Reply-To field is empty in both.

When I send an email from account A and the recipient responds, the reply frequently shows up in account B. The sent folder in account A shows the email with the proper account A sender address. But the reply in the account B inbox shows the account B address as the sender.

This does not happen when sending from account B, so far as I've seen.

One thing I did notice in the last case is that the response that arrived in account B came from a person in the CC list, not the To list.

I am currently working with recipients to try and figure out where the address gets changed.

But if anyone has seen something like this and there is already a solution, I'd like to know ;)

Bob
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:122.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/122.0;product:thunderbird;solver_id:842985

title: Help not helpful in finding default sender
creator: rmrubinsl
content: I was trying to get the answer to a simple question: How do you change the default sender in Thunderbird? The problem comes up when you click a "mailto" from a web page. The FROM address that was coming up was not one I wanted. Asking the question about the default sever brought up more than 150 discussions. Only after reading many them for more than half an hour, did I find the answer: In Account Settings, select Account Actions, then select Set as Default. Why isn't there a searchable user manual that would provide the answer to a simple question quickly? OK, the question may not be that simple because 'default sender' may be ambiguous. It might refer to the default SMTP server (the one used if you specify "Use default server" in your account settings for outgoing server). Or it could be the default identify, if your account has more than one identity (others, like me, may be pleased to learn you can have more than one identity in an account). In my case case, it meant the default account. But the number of meanings is finite. If a user queries for the default sender, the help facility should present the alternative meanings and ask the user which one is wanted. Wikipedia a disambiguation function. Can't Thunderbird have one as well?
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:122.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/122.0;product:thunderbird

title: We cannot send emails to Hotmail or Outlook accounts

content:
We cannot send emails to any Hotmail or MSN email address.

Can you please let me know how we resolve this?

title: Thunderbird 115.7.0 - Unified Folders
creator: TessWorld
content:
I just uploaded Thunderbird 115.7.0 hoping Unified Folders was once again actually being unified. Nope, no such luck.

I started using Thunderbird years ago for the exact Unified Folders feature, because I have to keep track of five email accounts, and Thunderfbird was/is the only email provider that allowed me to see all five at the same time.

Awhile ago after a Thunderbird upgrade Unified Folders stopped working. I said to myself, just give them time, they'll get it back on track, especially since so many users complained.

So far, crickets on the Unifided Folder issue.

Everyday I'm annoyed of having to scroll up and down to see in-boxes, and other folders. Only Sent and Trash are unified.

What the heck is going on over there, can't somebody address this pertinent problem? It's the strongest feature/reason so many people love Thunderbird, yet you treat users like we don't exhist.

TessWorld
metadata: ;category:customize;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Lost email contents
creator: ahkokesoffice
content:
I am able to still search and easy view my emails and their contents. However, if I attempt to open the email the contents of the email are gone and in accessible.

I need help fixing this issue as I am losing important correspondence.
